poem:
**Geminids Over Australia**

In the small hours  
of a Saturday morning,  
the sky unfurls its canvas—  
each meteor a quicksilver pen,  
scribbling fleeting sentences  
across the dark.  
Look up.  
Awake for this celestial ballet,  
as the universe punctuates  
between dreams and day.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Geminid meteor shower: when to best see Australia’s biggest shooting star show this weekend Australia will see its best and biggest meteor shower of the year when the Geminids meteors light up the sky early on Saturday. Here’s when and where to look out for the shooting stars. When will the meteor shower be? The meteor shower will be strongest between 2am and 4am on Saturday morning, with the best time to watch varying depending". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Geminid meteor shower: when to best see Australia’s biggest shooting star show this weekend Australia will see its best and biggest meteor shower of the year when the Geminids meteors light up the sky early on Saturday. Here’s when and where to look out for the shooting stars. When will the meteor shower be? The meteor shower will be strongest between 2am and 4am on Saturday morning, with the best time to watch varying depending
